discussion_comments.comment_body: The example is not runnable. See the other examples.

The other examples in the `examples` folder are not enough since they don't require external packages. The best I could do, atm, was to make the example runnable out-the-box by using it to replace the `ui.js` file in a newly generated `npx creat-ink-app` project, after installing both dependencies `npm i react-router ink-select-input`. This seems a bit complicated to me. 

My suggestion is to remove the example `router/select-input` and integrate it into `docs/recipes/routing-with-react-router.md`, so that gives a better chance at explaing the right runtime and usage. What do you think ?

Actually I think unmounting with a custom error doesn't really make sense, it's only related to `exit()`. It's only useful for internal purposes. I think it should be removed from docs and this https://github.com/vadimdemedes/ink/blob/07ff24bd0a15adacad75cf04d7beb33bb733a2d2/src/render.js#L34 should be converted to `unmount: () => instance.unmount()` to prevent users from passing an error.
